Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces now joined) of the shoulder-section of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is grey in section and the interior is mostly worn away revealing the core, exterior slightly grooved and covered with a cream-coloured slip and with remains of one lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying contents as year 11 wine of the Aten domain.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 56
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393153) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393153)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Domain of Aten
